info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:32AM CDT until June 14 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN BENTON...WASHINGTON AND CENTRAL ADAIR COUNTIES... At 831 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tontitown to 2 miles northwest of Lincoln to 2 miles northeast of Adair State Park, moving east at 50 mph. The strongest storm along the line was located near Baron and will move into southeast Washington County Arkansas. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Siloam Springs... Lowell... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Gentry... Tontitown... West Fork... Lincoln... Cave Springs... Decatur... Westville... Greenland... Highfill... Watts... Springtown... Christie... Northwest Arkansas Regional Air... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 52 and 80. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
